sub_topic: Solving systems of linear equations with complex coefficients
message_1:
Solve the following system of linear equations with complex coefficients using Gaussian elimination:

2x + 3y + 4z = 11i 

3x + 5y + 9z = 8 + 3i

x + 2y + 3z = 6i - 3
message_2:
To solve this system of linear equations using Gaussian elimination, we will first write the augmented matrix:

| 2  3  4 | 11i
| 3  5  9 | 8 + 3i
| 1  2  3 | 6i - 3

Step 1: Eliminate x from the second and third rows.

R2 = R2 - (3/2)R1
R3 = R3 - (1/2)R1

| 2   3    4  |  11i
| 0   1/2  1/2 | -5/2 + 1/2i
| 0   1/2  1/2 | -3/2 + 5/2i

Step 2: Eliminate y from the third row.

R3 = R3 - R2

| 2   3    4  |  11i
| 0   1/2  1/2 | -5/2 + 1/2i
| 0   0    0  |  1 + 2i

Since the third row represents the equation 0x + 0y + 0z = 1 + 2i, which is a contradiction, there is no solution to this system of linear equations.
